result.execSummary:
The defendant Darin H Renaud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In Case #15CM476 on Counts #1 & #2 each, the Court sentences Mr. Renaud to serve 90 days Jail with Huber privileges.  Count #1 is consecutive to any other sentence in being. Count #2 is concurrent with Count #1.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Renaud on Probation for two years
Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

----to comply with the Alcohol Treatment Court rules and successfuly complete Alcohol Treatment Court

--to undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegals drugs

--to take all prescribed medication as prescribed

Arresting Agency: Lake Mills PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darin H Renaud

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of 2/12/16 Plea and Sentencing Hearing
with criminal case settlement and elements

[MK] cases #15CF404 and #15CM476 called at 2:19pm. 
Defendant Darin H Renaud in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In Case #15CF404 only:
--Mr. Renaud waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--Service of the Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited

As to both cases: 
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Count #1 in Case #15CF404, and on Counts #1 & #2 in Case #15CM476; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Renaud guilty, and orders Judgment of Convictions entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2 of Case #15CF404.

On Case #15CF404, Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Renaud to 3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months, consecutive to any previously imposed sentence. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served. 

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Renaud on Probation for two years, with conditions:    
--to serve 120 days  in the Jefferson County Jail, with work release privileges; to commence forthwith, followed immediately by 120 days on SCRAM X.  Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings
--Mr. Renaud is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process
--to comply with all conditions of the Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor store
--no operation of a motor vehicle without both a valid drivers license and Agent approval 
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to pay fine of $2000  + costs including the DNA surcharge
--to pay blood testing fees incurred by the Lake Mills Police Department of $56.74

The Court orders outright (not as conditions of Probation): 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  

--6 demerit points assessed

----------------------------------------------------------

In Case #15CM476 on Counts #1 & #2 each, the Court sentences Mr. Renaud to serve 90 days Jail with Huber privileges.  Count #1 is consecutive to any other sentence in being. Count #2 is concurrent with Count #1.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places Mr. Renaud on Probation for two years, with conditions: 
----to comply with the Alcohol Treatment Court rules and successfuly complete Alcohol Treatment Court
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges
--to give a DNA sample upon demand
--to undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegals drugs
--no presence in bars, tavern, liquor stores
--to take all prescribed medication as prescribed
The Court revokes Bail in each case.
recess 2:46pm.

Cases 15CF404, 15CM476 & 15CT426 called together at 11:01 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Darin H Renaud in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO ALL CASES: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived
; charges/penalties recited
AS TO 15CT426: Service of AMENDED complaint admitted; reading waived
On Motion of the State the Court Dismisses Case 15CT426, as after futher investigation that is now the felony matter

AS TO 15CM476 Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
15CF404: Upon agreement of parties, preliminary hearing time limits waived

Court requires a $3500 signature bond, to cover both cases, with conditions: 
- To comply with SCRAM as already ordered
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- No possession or ingestion of alcohol or illegal or drugs. 
- No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
- No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid d.l.
- Booking at JESO
Atty Svehlek requests matters be set for plea/sentencing mid-February, presents basis
ADA Shock: Reluctantly agreeable to proposal
Court agrees and informs parties that It is not likely to grant further delay
Recess: 11:09 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 2/12/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Cases 15CT426, 15CF404, and 15CM476 called at 3:02pm [mo]
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Renaud is unable to attend court today due to incliment weather; requests adjournment; gives case updates.

The Court authorizes a bench warrant and holds until tomorrow's scheduled hearing. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Cases will be adjourned until 11:00am tomorrow.
recess: 305

NEXT: Initial Appearance/Status Conference on 12/28/15 at 11:00am
